sentence.Network_en: On the left was a plantation of almond trees.
It was springtime and the slopes were ablaze with almond blossoms.
sentence.Network_cn: 时当春季,怒放的扁桃花使那片山坡鲜红似火.

sentence.Network_en: In Castel Molo, high above Taormina, you can sample the famous almond wine made there.
sentence.Network_cn: 在陶尔米纳山高处的莫罗堡，你可以品尝那里酿造的著名的杏仁酒。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old French alemande, from medieval Latin amandula, from Greek amugdalē

entry.def: Almonds are pale oval nuts. They are often used in cooking.
An almond or an almond tree, is a tree on which almonds grow.

example.ex: On the left was a plantation of almond trees.

means.word_mean: 1. small bushy deciduous tree native to Asia and North Africa having pretty pink blossoms and highly prized edible nuts enclosed in a hard green hull; cultivated in southern Australia and California
2. oval-shaped edible seed of the almond tree
